conclusion: There are two cloths, A and B, and two sets of blocks, C and D on the left side, and E and F on the right side.
The cloths are initially held up, and the blocks are positioned under them.
The cloths A and B are moved through the air and placed down at the locations of the blocks C, D, E, and F.
Gravity will act on the cloths, causing them to fall onto the blocks.
When the cloths fall onto the blocks due to gravity, they will cover the blocks completely.
The cloths will drape over the blocks, conforming to their shapes.
In the image provided, the cloths are shown draping over the blocks, covering them, with the edges of the cloths hanging down.
The cloths will cover the blocks completely due to gravity.
The final arrangement will have the cloths draped over the blocks, as shown in the image.
